verses.roman:
taila-droṇyāṁ mṛtaṁ prāsya
jagāma gajasāhvayam
kṛṣṇāya viditārthāya
taptācakhyau pitur vadham

synonyms: taila—of oil; droṇyām—in a large vessel; mṛtam—the corpse; prāsya—putting; jagāma—she went; gaja-sāhvayam—to Hastināpura, the Kuru capital; kṛṣṇāya—to Kṛṣṇa; vidita-arthāya—who already was aware of the situation; taptā—sorrowful; ācakhyau—she related; pituḥ—of her father; vadham—the killing.
translation: Queen Satyabhāmā put her father's corpse in a large vat of oil and went to Hastināpura, where she sorrowfully told Lord Kṛṣṇa, who was already aware of the situation, about her father's murder.
